trans-unit.source: Represents the resource type for a claim that is created from a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement"></xref>.
Use the SamlAuthenticationClaimResource class to create a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> instance for a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> authentication claim.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> class has a constructor that takes a resource, which this class can be passed to.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify when the subject was authenticated.
The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements.
The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement>.
A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement> asserts that the statement's subject is authenticated by a particular means at a particular time.
The SamlAuthenticationClaimResource class represents a claim resource for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationClaimResource"></xref> class using the specified instant in time, authentication method, DNS domain name, and IP address.
The set of authentication methods is extensible; however the following table contains the set of authentication methods defined in the SAML specification.

|Authentication method|URI| |---------------------------|---------| |Password|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:password| |Kerberos|urn:ietf:rfc:1510| |Secure Remote Password (SRP)|urn:ietf:rfc:2945| |Hardware Token|URI:urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:HardwareToken| |SSL/TLS Certificate Based Client Authentication|urn:ietf:rfc:2246| |PGP Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:PGP| |SPKI Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:SPKI| |XKMS Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:XKMS| |XML Digital Signature|urn:ietf:rfc:3075| |Unspecified|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified|
A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
A URI reference that specifies how the subject was authenticated.
The DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.
The IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationClaimResource"></xref> class using the specified instant in time, authentication method, DNS domain name, IP address, and reference to additional information.
The set of authentication methods is extensible; however the following table contains the set of authentication methods defined in the SAML specification.

|Authentication method|URI| |---------------------------|---------| |Password|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:password| |Kerberos|urn:ietf:rfc:1510| |Secure Remote Password (SRP)|urn:ietf:rfc:2945| |Hardware Token|URI:urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:HardwareToken| |SSL/TLS Certificate Based Client Authentication|urn:ietf:rfc:2246| |PGP Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:PGP| |SPKI Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:SPKI| |XKMS Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:XKMS| |XML Digital Signature|urn:ietf:rfc:3075| |Unspecified|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified|
A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
A URI reference that specifies how the subject was authenticated.
The DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.
The IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding"></xref> that contains additional information about the subject.
authorityBindings contains a member that is .

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationClaimResource"></xref> class using the specified instant in time, authentication method, DNS domain name, IP address, and reference to additional information.
The set of authentication methods is extensible; however the following table contains the set of authentication methods defined in the SAML specification.

|Authentication method|URI| |---------------------------|---------| |Password|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:password| |Kerberos|urn:ietf:rfc:1510| |Secure Remote Password (SRP)|urn:ietf:rfc:2945| |Hardware Token|URI:urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:HardwareToken| |SSL/TLS Certificate Based Client Authentication|urn:ietf:rfc:2246| |PGP Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:PGP| |SPKI Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:SPKI| |XKMS Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:XKMS| |XML Digital Signature|urn:ietf:rfc:3075| |Unspecified|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified|
A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
A URI reference that specifies how the subject was authenticated.
The DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.
The IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.
An <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding"></xref> that contains additional information about the subject.
authorityBindings contains a member that is .
Gets the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.

The AuthenticationInstant property corresponds to the `AuthenticationInstant` attribute of the `<AuthenticationStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
Gets or sets the method that was used to authenticate the subject.
The set of authentication methods is extensible; however the following table contains the set of authentication methods defined in the SAML specification.

|Authentication method|URI| |---------------------------|---------| |Password|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:password| |Kerberos|urn:ietf:rfc:1510| |Secure Remote Password (SRP)|urn:ietf:rfc:2945| |Hardware Token|URI:urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:HardwareToken| |SSL/TLS Certificate Based Client Authentication|urn:ietf:rfc:2246| |PGP Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:PGP| |SPKI Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:SPKI| |XKMS Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:XKMS| |XML Digital Signature|urn:ietf:rfc:3075| |Unspecified|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified| The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationMethod%2A> property corresponds to the `AuthenticationMethod` attribute of the `<AuthenticationStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The method that was used to authenticate the subject.
Gets additional information about the subject.

The AuthorityBindings property corresponds to a set of `<AuthorityBinding>` child elements for an `<AuthenticationStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
An <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding"></xref> that contains additional information about the subject.
Gets the DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.

The DnsAddress property corresponds to the `DNSAddress` attribute of the `<SubjectLocality>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.
Returns a value that indicates whether the instance is equal to the specified object.
An object to compare to this instance.
if obj is a and has the same value as this instance; otherwise, .
Returns the hash code for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationClaimResource"></xref>.
A hash code for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationClaimResource"></xref>.
Gets or sets the IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.

The IPAddress property corresponds to the `IPAddress` attribute of the `<SubjectLocality>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.
